mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Thornton, William, 1759-1828
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Encloses a letter to Jefferson from Punqua Winchong, a Chinese Mandarin; Thornton translated. Translation: Winchong wishes he could have met Jefferson before he departed; has been well treated in this country and will endeavor to have his country return the civilities he received. [Enclosure included, of July 1808, n.p.].
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1808 July 22, "City of Washington," [D.C.] to Thomas Jefferson, n.p.
